messages.message: I want to update the credentials for AWS for Core platform service. I tried following this (https://docs.google.com/document/d/1YA1mqwNzrxFUN2m1hLT3-IooyJ6lPvShug76mL6A2Pg/edit?tab=t.0), adding it in env-local-overrides and restarting *CPS* (not api-server / CAT since this is affecting something else) but I get this error :thread:

I think the issue that i'm seeing is that restarting services doesn't work but restarting the workspace does, specifically with core platform service. I've seen this for the past couple of days
i ssh in CPS, didn't found any AWS varaible
Use grep -i since I think we use AWS instead of aws
oh uppercase.
When you restarted services, did you see if CPS AWS key actually got changed?
I didnt, but actually I think the issue isn't with AWS keys changing, rather `cs restart core-platform` gives the error above on step 5 or 6
the error Unauthorized , maybe they key didn't get updated
Cause yesterday the same thing happened when I was trying to rebuild CPS with changes not related to AWS
The only workaround I found was restarting the workspace
How do you trigger the error? By adding this?
Yes and doing cs restart CPS
ok, let me try it on my side too
But one thing you can do is, instead of adding a config, try to add a print statement in a go file and restart it. I think the same error will show up when building CPS
what go file , can you share the path?
Yesterday I was editing `shared-utils/go-utils/src/instabase/coreplatformservice/repo/handler/deployed_solutions.go`

FAILED: Build did NOT complete successfully

make: Leaving directory '/home/owner/instabase/core-services/core-platform-service'

i added this
Could you add that in a function? I think otherwise, it's syntactically incorrect

```Make sure core-platform-service doesn't use these override AWS keys, since it needs env-local-secrets.json's for accessing files from S3 dogfood```
for the ERROR: failed to build: failed to solve, i think i fixed it
Itâ€™s basically the same error we faced last week.
